name: Beefy Pizza Roll-Up
description: These beefy pizza roll-ups are great as an entree or used as an appetizer. Delicious flavor.
recipeIngredient: ½ (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese
1 tablespoon olive oil, or as needed
2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, or to taste
¼ teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) can pizza sauce, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Add onion; cook until translucent, about 3 minutes more. (Drain and discard grease.)
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Roll out dough onto a baking sheet. Layer pepperoni, beef mixture, Cheddar cheese, and mozzarella cheese in the center of the dough. Roll up and seal all ends. Brush with olive oil; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and sea salt.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
Pour pizza sauce into a microwave-safe bowl; heat in the microwave until warm, 3 to 4 minutes. Serve alongside pizza roll.

review.reviewBody: 3.12.18 First I want to say that this recipe tells you to brown the ground beef and onion but doesn t tell you what to do with it??? Hopefully Allrecipes will see this error and correct it. I assumed it was to be put inside the pizza roll and it was the first thing I put down on the dough. I just couldn t see only ground beef and onion so I did add some Italian seasoning garlic powder and crushed red pepper flakes. I did let the ground beef mixture cool a bit but it still was a bit of a struggle rolling this up but it did bake up looking O.K. Be prepared to eat this with a fork because you won t be able to eat it with your hands. I m not sure I d use both cheddar and mozzarella cheeses the next time (just couldn t taste both of them); most likely I ll just stick with mozzarella. We love pizza in this house it was nice having something other than a round traditional pie and it turned out pretty well.

It's easy and fun to make and eat and I suspect kids will love it 'as is'. I found it a little bland so the next time I will spice it up a little. Instead of making one big pizza roll I rolled the dough out very thin and made several smaller ones. They were easier to eat that way and I froze the leftovers. I'm hoping they'll reheat well for a quick lunch or dinner. Update: Freezing them worked really well! After defrosting I threw them in my toaster oven and they made for a nice fast hot meal with no fuss.
